oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup - 1947-01-30 - KOMA - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part two of a performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on January 30, 1947 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Hiram Higsby (master of ceremonies, writer), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chuck Davis; Roundup Boys; Ann Bond; Jack Beasley;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Allan Page and Hiram Higsby introduce the show / (0:35) Chuck Davis and the Roundup Boys perform "Spanish Cavalier" / (1:40) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (2:07) Ann Bond performs "Dude Cowboy" / (3:43) Hiram Higsby tells a joke / (4:10) Jack Beasley performs "Each Night At Nine" / (6:32) Hiram Higsby introduces the next song / (6:39) The Oklahoma Songbirds perform "Home Sweet Home On The Prairie" / (8:20) Lem Hawkins tells a joke / (9:17) Lem Hawkins performs "I Don’t Want To Be Rich" [unconfirmed] / (10:50) Hiram Higsby introduces the next song / (11:01) Mary Lou performs "No More The Moon Shines On Lorena" / (13:17) Hiram Higsby introduces the next song / (13:27) Closing theme and statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; CBS Inc.; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); Davis, Chuck; Bond, Ann; Beasley, Jack;
